muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                 n_1       n_2      n_3       n_4       n_5       n_6       n_7
#> sample_1  4.4312831  7.965503 4.533326 2.3716991 15.648955  7.804901 8.7686839
#> sample_2  0.6111367 10.006046 3.663485 1.3984690  5.964708  5.766238 2.6597268
#> sample_3  3.7132221  2.298960 3.083698 0.1115525  6.807322  7.696211 1.4150922
#> sample_4 11.3411845 11.180825 2.209270 3.3759496 11.365723 10.528884 4.0890766
#> sample_5  2.5695107  3.903307 1.751272 7.3874088  3.335666  9.616009 0.3933815
#>                n_8       n_9       n_10
#> sample_1 5.8343928 4.2369202  0.8976105
#> sample_2 0.3907771 4.4055221  9.6156296
#> sample_3 3.6589100 4.5871575 10.0002943
#> sample_4 4.1961681 1.5659300  4.9681584
#> sample_5 3.7723079 0.8173876  1.9598899
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
